definition: the five Liang of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Liang 前涼|前凉 (314-376), Later Liang 後涼|后凉 (386-403), Northern Liang 北涼|北凉 (398-439), Southern Liang 南涼|南凉 (397-414), Western Liang 西涼|西凉 (400-421)

sentences.english: Wear your favorite pair of open-toe shoes or sandals.
sentences.chinese: 穿你喜欢的露脚趾的凉鞋或拖鞋。

sentences.english: In the center of town is a pair of 20-foot-long sheet metal shidas.
sentences.chinese: 垨市中心有一双20英尺长的金属凉鞋雕塑。

sentences.english: Came all these sexy sandals, sexy pumps, platform shoes " stripper."
sentences.chinese: 所有这些来到性感凉鞋，性感泵，汽提塔松糕鞋。

sentences.english: I suffer from beriberi to already had a few years, need to change sandal to just go to the summer.
sentences.chinese: 我患脚气病已有几年了，一到夏季需换上凉鞋才行。

sentences.english: The sheen of my sandals is dulled by the dust of cloves.
sentences.chinese: 我的凉鞋蒙上了丁香的灰尘。

sentences.english: Pebbled leather gladiator sandals in black.
sentences.chinese: 鹅卵石皮革黑角斗士凉鞋。

sentences.english: an eggshell-blue trouser suit with white sandals.
sentences.chinese: 穿着蛋壳蓝套装和白色凉鞋。

sentences.english: Can you fix my broken sandal?
sentences.chinese: 我凉鞋坏了，你能给修修吗？

sentences.english: Gladiator-inspired sandals are made of reptile-embossed synthetic leather.
sentences.chinese: 角斗士的灵感凉鞋的爬行动物压花合成革。

sentences.english: The pair of dilapidted sandals were beside her chair.
sentences.chinese: 破凉鞋在她的椅子旁边搁着。

sentences.english: "Some of the them, " he writes, "were learning to ride wearing open-toe sandals on boards with no grip tape."
sentences.chinese: 他们有些人学着穿露趾凉鞋来滑板，不用粘胶带。

sentences.english: So, the platforms can be worn as day-to-night sandals.
sentences.chinese: 所以，厚底凉鞋可以从早穿到晚。

sentences.english: Make every day an adventure with the Kodiak sandal.
sentences.chinese: 使每一天的科迪亚克凉鞋的冒险。

sentences.english: She wore sandals, and she was very dirty.
And heeled espadrilles even look great with shorts.
sentences.chinese: 坡跟凉鞋搭配短裤看起来效果也很棒。

definition: flip-flops/abbr. for 人字拖鞋[ren2 zi4 tuo1 xie2]
